revised_title: Development and Structure of Antedon rosaceus
tldr: The author conducts research on the structure, physiology, and development of Antedon rosaceus, a unique and rare species of the Crinoidea order. The study aims to provide a better understanding of this group of animals and contribute to the solution of fundamental questions in general physiology. The research focuses on the peculiar interest of Antedon as a typical form, being the only representative of the Crinoidea order in British seas. The author also discusses the history of Antedon research, from the earliest accounts by Fabius Columella to the works of Edward Lhuyd and others.
